title: ST201 Module Information
text:
Information

1 Midterm worth 10% (November 12th)

📖 Textbooks:

Introduction to Statistical and Data Analysis by Christian Heimann & Michael Schomaker Shalabh

⏰ Office Hours: By appointment (and please do make an appointment if needed)

title: ST201 Module Information
text:
Lecturing format

Lecture notes will be shared, but don’t hesitate to take your own notes for deeper understanding. 📝
Slides will be uploaded to Moodle for easy access after class. 💻
Expect a mix of formats! Some lectures will focus on slides, while others will involve hands-on R coding in RStudio—a key part of this course. 💡💻
Relevant R code will be provided along with the lecture notes to enhance your learning. 📊💻
Got questions? Don’t be shy—ask them during the lecture! 🙋‍♂️🙋‍♀️

title: ST201 Module Information
text:
What Topics Will We Cover?
The objective of this module is to introduce students to the fundamentals of Data Analysis using R. This course will cover (but is not limited to) the following topics:

📊 Numerical and graphical data summaries
📈 Measures of central tendency
🔗 Association of two or more variables
🤝 Correlation
📉 Regression

title: ST201 Module Information
text:
Diversity & inclusion
It is my intent to present materials and activities that are respectful of diversity: gender identity, sexuality, disability, age, socioeconomic status, ethnicity, race, nationality, religion, and culture. I may not always get this right so please let me know ways to improve the effectiveness of the course for you personally, or for other students or student groups.
To help with this:

If you have a name that differs from those that appear in your official University records, please let me know!
Please let me know your preferred pronouns if you wish to do so.
I (like many people) am still in the process of learning about diverse perspectives and identities. If something was said in class (by anyone) that made you feel uncomfortable, please talk to me about it.
